channel.title: Photo Catalog
channel.description: I am Raoul Pop, and this is my online photography catalog. The photos are organized into albums and sorted by location. You can search for specific photos by keywords as well. Contact me if you'd like to purchase a print or license a photo. Join me at my personal site to read about the various places I've photographed.

item.title: 8:07 pm in Frankfurt
item.description:
The clock of what looks to be the oldest Gothic church tower in Frankfurt shows seven minutes past eight o'clock. The dusk sky glows with a deep blue hue.
In album Frankfurt am Main

item.title: Rectangles in the night
item.description:
The large windows of a converted historical building create an interesting contrast in the wall. Half of them are lit, half are unlit. The orange glow of the light within contrasts well with the blue twilight sky.
In album Frankfurt am Main

item.title: Cold September night
item.description:
One of the church towers in Frankfurt, set against the quickly darkening twilight sky. The broad leaves of two trees hang in the air above, slightly out of focus, creating the impression of being superimposed onto the photo.
In album Frankfurt am Main

item.title: Frankfurt Gothic
item.description:
Arch and relief artwork on one of the old gothic churches in Frankfurt.
In album Frankfurt am Main

item.title: Alte Brcke
item.description:
A street sign and lights marking the intersection with Frankfurt's old bridge over the river Main.
In album Frankfurt am Main

item.title: The River Main
item.description:
A long exposure of the River Main at night gives it an icy appearance. A boat motors its way into the foreground from bottom right, while one of the bridges over the river is well lit for the upcoming Oktoberfest.
In album Frankfurt am Main

item.title: Frankfurt downtown at night
item.description:
The well-known Frankfurt am Main skyline, at night, as seen from one of the bridges over the river Main.
In album Frankfurt am Main

item.title: Green power
item.description:
Someday perhaps we'll derive most of our energy from non-polluting sources such as the sun and the wind. Until then...
In album Potomac (MD)

item.title: Lobotomized for shopping pleasure
item.description:
A statuette resembling Aphrodite or Athena, with the top of the head lopped off. Quite common these days, possibly signifying the loss of judgment that is needed when one is to enjoy all that the world has to offer.
In album At Home

item.title: Life, as I want to know it
item.description:
A foggy morning in the Virginia countryside, in an open meadow outside an evergreen forest.
In album Natural Bridge (VA)

item.title: The evening breeze
item.description:
Stems of long grass flutter in the cool evening wind.
In album North Bethesda, MD

item.title: Mack the Knife
item.description:
The claw-like leaves of a palm leaf with the sun's rays shining through.
In album At Home

item.title: Cutting edge
item.description:
The edge of a tropical plant's elongated leaf is shown in macro mode.
In album At Home

item.title: Fog in the fields
item.description:
On a cold winter's night outside the village of Cogealac, in Dobrogea, Romania. Fog is starting to roll in, covering the patches of ice. A full moon illuminates the fields, while the village lights shine in the distance.
In album Cogealac

item.title: Tulcea III
item.description:
Another view of Tulcea's large city sign, with the monument in the background.
In album Tulcea

item.title: Upon a mid-winter night
item.description:
The winter sky above the Tulcea port, illuminated by the city lights, and seen through the barren branches of a couple of old trees.
In album Tulcea

item.title: Tulcea II
item.description:
The city of Tulcea and the Danube River at dusk, as seen through the large Tulcea sign at the top of monument hill.
In album Tulcea

item.title: A bend in the river
item.description:
The U-shaped bend in the Danube River that happens when it meets the shores of Tulcea can be seen in the background of this photo. The town's periphery and its port can be seen in the foreground.
In album Tulcea

item.title: Old and new, industrial and residential
item.description:
This is a closer look at the hillside that faces the Tulcea port. Here we see an interesting mix of the old and the new (notice the older homes in the foreground vs the younger, multi-story apartment buildings on the Danube quay), and the industrial and residential (the homes are located next to a factory or plant of sorts, whose furnace blows steam into the night air, and the crane in the background belongs to the port).
In album Tulcea

item.title: Tulcea cityscape
item.description:
The rooftops and lights of the northern part of the city (the one facing the Danube River), at night.
In album Tulcea

item.title: A cold but beautiful winter night
item.description:
When I say cold, I mean it. Brrrr! My hands were frozen stiff the whole time. A chilly wind blew up the hillside from the Danube river, which is visible mid-right in this photo and froze me through and through. City lights cast a wonderful glow on the city in the distance, while street lights shone through the stems and branches of the evergreens on the left. I love the colors in this photo, it's one of my favorites from that session.
In album Tulcea

item.title: Tulcea at night
item.description:
The lights of the city fill the air above with a sodium glow during a cold and windy winter night.
In album Tulcea

item.title: Colors of dusk
item.description:
The fading dusk painted the sky with lovely hues of purple, gold, white and orange. This was taken somewhere on the road to Constanta, in Dobrogea.
In album On the Road (RO)

item.title: On my way
item.description:
A country road paved with gravel awaits me. Taken somewhere near the village of Cogealac, in Dobrogea, Romania.
In album On the Road (RO)

item.title: The distance
item.description:
Dobrogea is a province of wide open fields, as you can see here. Villages dot the landscape here and there, and old mountains, worn down to hills by time and wind, rise up here and there. This was taken near Cogealac, a larger village near Constanta.
In album Cogealac

item.title: Twilight in the open field
item.description:
The sun has gone below the horizon, the semilune is up, and the field would be eerily quiet but for the howling wind. Photo taken somewhere near Cogealac, in the province of Dobrogea, Romania.
In album Cogealac

item.title: The long road
item.description:
Taken in mid-winter, somewhere in Dobrogea, on the road to Constanta.
In album On the Road (RO)

item.title: Mid-winter dusk in Dobrogea
item.description:
Taken in mid-winter, somewhere in Dobrogea, on the road to Constanta. I love how the sun's rays light up the shrubs in this open field.
In album On the Road (RO)

item.title: Parallel roads
item.description:
Taken in mid-winter, somewhere in Dobrogea, on the road to Constanta.
In album On the Road (RO)

item.title: The port of Tulcea
item.description:
Taken on a cold winter night. The quay and the Danube River are visible toward the top of the photo.
In album Tulcea

item.title: Footsteps in the snow
item.description:
The many footsteps of the visitors to Tulcea's monument hill are visible in the foreground. It's late afternoon and the sun is low over the horizon. The Danube River is just off to the right.
In album Tulcea

item.title: Footsteps in the snow
item.description:
It's the same scene as portrayed in a previous photo by the same name, this time at night. The Tulcea skyline is no longer visible. Only tiny lights give away its location, while seeming ghosts patrol the steps.
In album Tulcea

item.title: Christmas bokeh
item.description:
A Christmas tree still stands in the piazza below monument hill in Tulcea, Romania. It's after New Year's, but it's a welcome sight in the cold winter night.
In album Tulcea

item.title: Winter late afternoon in Tulcea
item.description:
The sun approaches the horizon over the city of Tulcea, in Romania.   It's the middle of winter, and the chilly wind of the Danube River, just off to the right, freezes me to the bone as I take this photo.
In album Tulcea

item.title: Tulcea
item.description:
The large, illuminated sign which marks Tulcea's monument hill, casts a yellow-greenish glow on the ground below, and in the cold winter air above.
In album Tulcea

item.title: Afternoon view
item.description:
A japanese maple from our neighborhood, bathed in afternoon light. Taken in North Bethesda, MD, USA.
In album North Bethesda, MD

item.title: Walking in the foam
item.description:
A quiet seagull walks through the foam of the waves, ever on the lookout for food.
In album Hollywood (FL)

item.title: Winter in FL
item.description:
Standing at the southern end of Hollywood Beach, looking north toward the Boardwalk and Ft. Lauderdale.
In album Hollywood (FL)

item.title: Palm tree and lifeguard station
item.description:
Somewhere in Hollywood Beach, FL.
In album Hollywood (FL)

item.title: The Earth is round II
item.description:
Standing somewhere on Hollywood Beach, FL. The bowed horizon line is visible in the distance, indicating the curvature of the Earth.
In album Hollywood (FL)

item.title: The patter of little feet
item.description:
A couple of small sandpipers run through the sand looking for even tinier crustaceans and other morsels of food.
In album Hollywood (FL)

item.title: Hibiscus in the garden
item.description:
RAW shot of a hibiscus flower taken with a Kodak zoom camera I tested. Will publish the review of the camera on raoulpop.com in the next couple of weeks.
In album At Home

item.title: At night in FL
item.description:
Palm fronds sway in the cool winter breeze.
In album Hollywood (FL)

item.title: One hand down, two to go
item.description:
A royal palm tree sways in the brisk night breeze in South Florida. Three of its fronds are ready to fall.
In album Hollywood (FL)

item.title: Sunrise in South Caroline
item.description:
On the side of the road in South Caroline, on I-95, in the early hours of the morning.
In album On the Road (US)

item.title: Cottonball sky
item.description:
Somewhere in South Carolina or Georgia, on I-95. The whole sky was literrally filled with these clouds. I'd never seen them fill the sky to this extent before. Highly unusual occurrence for me.
In album On the Road (US)

item.title: Forward
item.description:
Somewhere in South Carolina, on I-95. Life and travel are often alike, aren't they? If you don't stop to look around, things pass you right by.
In album On the Road (US)

item.title: Daybreak near gas station
item.description:
There was a gas station right behind me when I took this photo.   We'd been driving through the night and stopped to get gas somewhere in North or South Carolina. The station was closed and so were the pumps.   I paused to take a few photos. I stood the camera on the roof of the car and exposed this scene for a little over a second.   It was mid-winter. I was thoroughly frozen and my teeth were clanking by the time I got back into the car.
In album On the Road (US)

item.title: Frosty the Christmas sleigh
item.description:
Fun little sleigh, isn't it? Interesting choice to put a lighthouse near the archetypal winter cabin.
In album At Home
